required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Bronchoscopic Interventions for Malignant Airway Obstruction
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Effectiveness of Bronchoscopic Interventions for Malignant Airway Obstruction

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this clinical research study is learn about side effects and the success of bronchoscopies when performed in cancer patients with and without symptoms.
This is an investigational study.
Up to 110 patients will take part in this study. All will be enrolled at MD Anderson.

detailed_description.textblock:
If participant agrees to take part in this study, researchers will collect information from participant's medical records.
Length of Study:
Researchers will continue to collect participant's medical information for up to 2 years.
Additional Information:
Participant's data will be kept in a database on a password-protected computer in a secure office. This information will only be available to the study doctors and staff.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Any Complication Requiring Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Researchers will estimate the hazard function of time to any complications in the framework of competing risks while death is the competing risk.3 Researchers will graphically visualize the hazard function of time to any complications using Kernel smoothing method.

secondary_outcome.description: Researchers will evaluate the relationship between covariates and quality-adjusted survival.

other_outcome.description: Early intervention cases defined as those with anatomic narrowing and no or mild dyspnea (as measured by the Borg score).
Late intervention cases defined as those with moderate or severe dyspnea due to airway narrowing.

arm_group.description: Medical information collected after bronchoscopy for up to 2 years.

intervention.description: Medical information collected after bronchoscopy for up to 2 years.

study_pop.textblock: Participants scheduled for standard of care bronchoscopy at UT MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston, Texas.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Â° All patients undergoing interventional bronchoscopy during the first 12 months will be enrolled, with follow-up occurring out to 2 years from the study startup (the duration of the grant).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 years,
- Inability to participate in telephone follow-up

facility.name: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center
